4. Infection - The presence of low-grade fevers and elevated WBC count suggests a possible infection. If not appropriately treated, it can progress and lead to sepsis, a life-threatening condition.
5. VAP - Ventilator-associated pneumonia is a type of lung infection that occurs in patients receiving mechanical ventilation. If not promptly diagnosed and treated, it can worsen and lead to respiratory failure.
